chickpea_details.description: Chickpea, also known as garbanzo bean, is a legume known for its nutty flavor and versatility in cooking. It is a staple ingredient in many cuisines.
chickpea_details.nutritional value: Chickpeas are an excellent source of plant-based protein, dietary fiber, vitamins, and minerals. They support digestive health, heart health, and blood sugar control.
chickpea_details.cultivation: Chickpeas are primarily grown in arid and semi-arid regions with well-drained soil. They require warm temperatures during the growing season and are tolerant of drought.

prerequisites.soil: Well-drained, sandy or loamy soil with pH between 6.0 and 7.5
prerequisites.climate: Warm and dry climate with temperatures between 70°F to 85°F (21°C to 29°C) during the growing season
prerequisites.water: Chickpeas are drought-tolerant but require occasional watering, especially during flowering and pod formation.
prerequisites.frost: Chickpeas are sensitive to frost, so they should be planted after the last frost date.
prerequisites.space: Sufficient spacing between plants, typically 4-6 inches apart in rows spaced 12-18 inches apart.
